children.title: How question linking works:
children.label: How question linking works:
children.value:
This ID is displayed at the top of each module question as a large piece of text that looks something like this:
52c2b1ac-2f95-48e7-80ee-dff576baf563
It serves as the unique identifier that links the module to the specific question we want to track for submission. Once the question is submitted, it will trigger the generation of additional questions based on the submitted code.

children.title: Note:
children.label: Note:
children.value: Currently, only the BasicQuestion module has been implemented as part of early development. This means that the system will only consider the first answer provided for the specified question. If the question contains multiple responses, only the first one (typically a text box response, such as short answer or long answer on the BasicQuestion module) will be processed and used for generating subsequent questions.

children.tooltip: Enter the number of questions that you would like the AI to generate

children.label: Question Type
children.tooltip: Select the type of questions to be generated

children.label: Topics Assessed
children.tooltip: List the topics you would like the AI to generate on

children.label: Code Language
children.tooltip: Select the programming language which the code that should be submitted will be

children.label: Code Context
children.tooltip: Optional: The context of what the task the student was asked to do. This can better help tailor question generation.

children.label: Code Template
children.tooltip: Optional: The code which was used given by the students for the task. Leave blank if all the code is the students. This allows for the AI to not ask questions about things the student didnt write.
